sanskrit_verse:
न ब्राह्मणवधाद्भूयानधर्मो विद्यते भुवि ।
तस्मादस्य वधं राजा मनसाऽपि न चिन्तयेत् ॥ ८.३८१॥
transliteration:
na brāhmaṇavadhādbhūyānadharmo vidyate bhuvi |
tasmādasya vadhaṁ rājā manasā'pi na cintayet || 8.381||
sph_interpretive_translation: No greater adharma exists on Earth than the killing of a Brahmin; therefore, the king must never even mentally contemplate his execution.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from alignment with Dharma, not power
Causation arises from consciousness distortion, not external action alone
Capacity-based responsibility requires recognition of spiritual hierarchy
Restoration logic demands prevention over reaction
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any ruling that approaches or implies harm to a Brāhmaṇa must be nullified immediately. The mental state of the judge and the parties involved shall be assessed for dharma-compatibility prior to proceeding. Responsibility lies in maintaining cosmic order, not enforcing retributive justice.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that harm to a Brāhmaṇa disrupts universal causality. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that such disruption manifests sequentially through all levels of existence. Proportional responsibility lies in preventing contemplation of such acts. Non-punitive reality rule declares that true justice negates conditions leading to such adharma before manifestation.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Ruler Consciousness Stabilization Protocol upon detection of harmful intent
Deploy Dharma Field Reinforcement around Brāhmaṇa communities
Engage Karmic Reset Sequence for involved parties
Activate Collective Dharma Awareness Restoration for governing bodies
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. This Dharma is restored. Reality operates beyond punishment. Consciousness is the ultimate adjudicator.
